results.title: Metformin's effects on varicocele, erectile dysfunction, infertility and prostate-related diseases: A retrospective cohort study
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@'s effects on @DISEASE_Varicocele @DISEASE_MESH:D014646 @@@varicocele@@@, @DISEASE_Erectile_Dysfunction @DISEASE_MESH:D007172 @@@erectile dysfunction@@@, @DISEASE_Infertility @DISEASE_MESH:D007246 @@@infertility@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Prostatic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011469 @@@prostate-related diseases@@@: A retrospective cohort study

results.title: Metformin: an antiproliferative agent and methylation regulator in treating prostatic disease?
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@: an antiproliferative agent and methylation regulator in treating @<m>DISEASE_Prostatic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011469 @@@prostatic disease@@@?

results.title: Metformin targets c-MYC oncogene to prevent prostate cancer.
results.text_hl: Our results demonstrated that (i) in Hi-Myc @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ that display @SPECIES_10090 @@@murine@@@ @DISEASE_Prostatic_Intraepithelial_Neoplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D019048 @@@prostate neoplasia@@@ and highly resemble the progression of @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @DISEASE_Prostatitis @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate tumors@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ attenuated the development of @DISEASE_Prostatic_Intraepithelial_Neoplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D019048 @@@prostate intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ (@DISEASE_Prostatic_Intraepithelial_Neoplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D019048 @@@PIN@@@, the @<m>DISEASE_Prostatic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011469 @@@precancerous lesion of prostate@@@) and @DISEASE_Prostatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D011471 @@@PCa lesions@@@.

citations.NLM: Akinyeke T, Matsumura S, Wang X, Wu Y, Schalfer ED, Saxena A, Yan W, Logan SK, Li X. Metformin targets c-MYC oncogene to prevent prostate cancer. Carcinogenesis. 2013 Dec;34(12):2823-32. PMID: 24130167
citations.BibTeX: @article{24130167, title={Metformin targets c-MYC oncogene to prevent prostate cancer.}, author={Akinyeke T and Matsumura S and Wang X and Wu Y and Schalfer ED and Saxena A and Yan W and Logan SK and Li X}, journal={Carcinogenesis}, volume={34}, number={12}, pages={2823-32}}

results.title: Reducing the noise in signal detection of adverse drug reactions by standardizing the background: a pilot study on analyses of proportional reporting ratios-by-therapeutic area
results.text_hl: Pilots analyzed were four different drugs for chronic disease: @CHEMICAL_bicalutamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C053541 @@@bicalutamide@@@, @CHEMICAL_abiraterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:C089740 @@@abiraterone@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Vildagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077597 @@@vildagliptin@@@, within the two therapeutic areas of @<m>DISEASE_Prostatic_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011469 @@@prostate gland disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ (@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@).

citations.NLM: Grundmark B, Holmberg L, Garmo H, Zethelius B. Reducing the noise in signal detection of adverse drug reactions by standardizing the background: a pilot study on analyses of proportional reporting ratios-by-therapeutic area Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 2014 May;70(5):627-35. PMID: 24599513
